website_summaries.verdict: An attractive coat from a known brand with many firm followers.
pros: The swaddling design of this coat makes it easy to put on
Lightweight fabric is also machine washable
cons: When choosing a size, it's best to go by the chest measurement rather than weight

customer_reviews.title: Chest size
customer_reviews.text: This thing worked great for my dog. But the main reason for my review is to offer advice when choosing the right size for your dog. I chose a medium coat, because it covers the weight range that my dog fits into. When it arrived, it was way too small. When choosing a size for your dog, it's best to use the chest size.
customer_reviews.author: RSD

customer_reviews.title: i had lost my happy, jumpy always ready for an outside activity pup
customer_reviews.text: Wow!!! i had heard these helped with loud noises, thunder storms etc. My lab mix, maxx, 13yrs, had become nervous, stressed, would not leave my side. i had lost my happy, jumpy always ready for an outside activity pup. His back legs are getting wobbly, and the vet stated this was normal in older dogs. I was devastated. i looked online for anything that might help my pup. i came across the body wrap and how it helps calm your dog. OMG!! after the 2nd day of wearing it, my Maxie is back!! he's alert, ready for outside, just amazing!!! what a change!!!! thank you so much for giving my pup back!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: So glad I bought this!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical but am a true believer in this product now! My 2 yo Ridgeback mix is terrified of storms. After sitting up until 5am with him as he shook uncontrollably was the deciding factor in buying this. He stood perfectly still when I put it on him when the next storm hit, curled up & slept through most of it. He also wore it on July 4th &.did very well. The extremely loud ones still startled him, but not like in the past. I highly recommend this! It does run a touch small...his chest measurement falls in the middle of the large size, it fits, but an XL might've been a little better.
customer_reviews.author: kelly smith

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this. Save your money.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this for two days and I’m already regretting it. The quality is just awful, and the Velcro is already coming off the fabric, see photo. I’ve put it on and taken it off maybe 4 times. Unfortunately for me, I bought three of them. I’m reluctant to return anything that’s been clearly used and since these dogs have worn them they are full of hair. I don’t feel right returning something like that, but at the same time I just threw away 90 Bucks. Spend your money on something more quality.
customer_reviews.author: Leon J. Rodrigues

customer_reviews.title: Okay, not great
customer_reviews.text: I researched a few different brands of these to help keep my pup a little calmer during storms as well as firework season and felt this one could be the ticket. I purchased a small for my Yorkiepoo. It fits, but I do wish there was more compression to it. Next time I will more than likely go for the Thunder Coat (or whatever it is actually called) to see if it gives her more of a 'squeeze' to help calm her nerves.
customer_reviews.author: Tay C.

customer_reviews.title: Worked for Us!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered the XL for our 70lb lab mix and it fits great. It was a last resort purchase to help him deal with separation anxiety and it worked! We moved and he started having accidents any time we left the house. After trying everything under the sun we gave this a shot. He's 5 days accident free. I can leave the house without dreading what I'm coming home to. Definitely worth a try!
customer_reviews.author: Serendipitymom

customer_reviews.title: Works for my nervous Fur Baby!
customer_reviews.text: I have a dog who is terribly frightened of thunder and fireworks and we tried EVERY other remedy out there. This coat is much more flexible than some, allowing you to "swaddle" your fur baby gently and it work like a charm for us! It's lightweight and washable. Be sure to take many measurements, as they are the key to getting the correct fit. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!
customer_reviews.author: Booklady

customer_reviews.title: Anxious and Stressed Out
customer_reviews.text: When I first put this on my dog, he literally froze for 10-minutes and didn't move a muscle. I thought, OK, this wasn't the reaction I was anticipating, but maybe it's not a bad thing. Eventually he started to move around. I've used it several times with limited or no success calming my dog. He's now at the point where he's more stressed out after I put it on him. He tries to remove it by rubbing up against tress and bushes. Also, the Velcro separate from the fabric on the neck part too. Which was disappointing, especially considering the cost. Maybe it's just my dog, but it did nothing to calm or relieving his stress.
customer_reviews.author: D. Hackett

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected.
customer_reviews.text: Our dog gas HUGE separation anxiety. She scratches and lacerates her face and head when no one is home. When the cone failed, and when the foot booties failed, and when clipping/grinding down her nails failed- this vest had to be our answer. She does well with it and it performs as it should. My only complaint is that the stitching is coming out and loose where the velcro meets. This is going to be an issue at some point. In other words- its already coming apart but its all we've got at the moment so it'll have to do. Cute pink color though!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works for my dog!
customer_reviews.text: I know every dog is different, but this product really did work! I hated coming home to my dog under a table and shaking during a thunderstorm, it broke my heart. I gave this a shot and it seriously works. A thunderstorm rolled in just as my workday ended and I rushed to put the jacket on her. She was shaking badly and panting heavily. Within 15 mins her panting stopped. Within 30 mins her shaking stopped. Within an hour she was asleep. To me, this was money well spent! I hope this product works for your dog as well.
customer_reviews.author: Wolverine

customer_reviews.title: Way too small
customer_reviews.text: Size chart isn't correct at all. My dog should be right in the middle of the weight/chest size for a large. It showed up and it was way too small. I could get the strap around her chest but the velcro had less than an inch where it was connected and it was way too tight. I know that it should be tight but this was Victorian corset kind of tight.
customer_reviews.author: Crocus

customer_reviews.title: Too complicated!
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used the product except in a dry (no pun intended) run. It came with insufficient directions (e.g., for even which was head and which was tails), but required multiple wrap-around actions--and in a set sequence, which you only can figure out by stretching the imagination from the picture of a dog encased in it. I cannot imagine trying to get it on a dog who is already upset by "thunder"/approaching climactic change/or whatever. Useless, and to try to use it would only add to the problem, not ameliorate it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeri Goldman

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: This didn't really work on my dog. It worked the first time I put it on my dog, but after that it didn't do anything. It was not easy to put on and was confusing unless you practiced putting it on a few times. The velcro came off and the stitching was coming apart. Not really worth it unless you know for sure your dog does well with a Thunder Jacket and you want a cheaper alternative. The only reason I didn't give it 1 star was because the material was soft and would have been comfortable on my dog so at least that was nice.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Lively

customer_reviews.title: It was easy to figure out and has helped tremendously in fact ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought a size small for my little shih tzu. He battles with severe anxiety especially when we leave him and during thunderstorms. The jacket works exactly how it is supposed to, it wraps around them and feels very comforting for them. It was easy to figure out and has helped tremendously in fact he has it on as I am typing this. It was really a last resort because we tried everything under the sun you could have thought of but I wish I had bought this item sooner. If you are on the fence just know it worked for my shih tzu who suffers severe anxiety.
customer_reviews.author: Simply

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I thought being AKC it would be a good fit. It’s made of thin jersey material (which is fine if it fit right on my dog). If your dog has a chest like a boxer, I would not recommend this. When I put it on my dog it didn’t look like the picture. The chest of the dog in the picture has almost a flat chest. That’s what this must be for and why it doesn’t work on my dog. It just slides to his chest. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Cherylbuzzy

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work for travel anxiety
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hoping it would help my dog with travel anxiety, but it did not. He still pants and whines and shakes the whole time we’re in the car. The one thing I did notice is that my dog seemed to be calmer during social interactions with this on. He didn’t seem to bark as much and was less snappy around small children and other animals. I will keep it for this reason, even though it didn’t work for the intended purpose. Also, I feel like I should note that my dog is absolutely terrified of the sound the Velcro makes when I try to take this off of him and he’s usually trying to scramble away.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan124

customer_reviews.title: Size guide off by at least 3”
customer_reviews.text: Female pup’s chest measurement behind the front legs measures 30.5, so sized up to a Large. Arrived today....nope - i’ve pulled it as tight as i can, and the velcro connects by maybe 1/16th of an inch. So....I’ll donate this one, and buy another. As well, this is a stretchy jersey knit, and I think I was expecting something a tad sturdier for her, so I’ll likely try the ThunderShirt brand this time.
customer_reviews.author: christy j

customer_reviews.title: Appears to Help with Anxiety
customer_reviews.text: We have a rescue that is afraid of many things from noises to other dogs and hates to be left alone, even if for only a few seconds. Using this appears to help her. She's still not perfectly calm, but appears to be better than without it. It is thinner than the Thunder Jacket, but works as well. Easy to wash, but make sure the velcro is fastened.
customer_reviews.author: Dee NTop Contributor: Amazon Echo

customer_reviews.title: It’s a HASSLE and a headache!
customer_reviews.text: This shirt is VERY difficult to wrap around a dog and the material is very thin. I tried to put it on a few different dogs and it was a HASSLE regardless of the dog’s temperament. It’s not worth the cost and I do NOT recommend purchasing this product. Don’t waste your time or your money! The competitor’s product costs a bit more and is well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: TNK

customer_reviews.title: Bought this thinking it would be just like the Thundershirt
customer_reviews.text: Bought this thinking it would be just like the Thundershirt. Guess again. This lasted about a week, couldn't withstand our dog's scratching (nails are trimmed regularly!). If you think this is a good substitute, think again. Pay the extra money and buy the real one! We did and it's much better made.
customer_reviews.author: sds

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money. Ask your local Vet about Trazodone for dogs
customer_reviews.text: My dog continued to shiver and shake while wearing this. The only difference was now she stood frozen and refused to move. She was as afraid of this anti anxiety shirt/jacket as she was of thunderstorms and loud noises. I finally found the cure for my nervous little dog. The vet gave us Trazodone for her. She stays calm during storms, the neighbors shooting guns and she can even sleep through the fireworks.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Foster

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing product.
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. Too tight on neck even if made as loose as possible by using a small portion of Velcro overlap. Flaps around back are too long and when I pull them tight the Velcro barely overlaps and will not stay closed. The extra fabric just flaps on his back It was off my dog by morning and in his crate. This product may be OK for a small dog, but I ordered am XL for my Doberman is it did not fit properly. Just really off the mark.
customer_reviews.author: Jodyh

customer_reviews.title: Wore Vest While Cowering Behind Couch
customer_reviews.text: We have a chihuahua mix that is approximately 7 years old. I bought this for her because she is afraid of loud noises like thunder and fireworks. We've had 2 thunderstorms since I bought this and the vest did not lessen her fear. If I were a better photographer, I could've taken a picture of her cowering behind the couch in her vest. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: janeaustinfan

customer_reviews.title: Dont go by weight  go by breed
customer_reviews.text: Dont go by the weight go by the breeds. I have a mini sheltie that is 11lbs so I ordered the XS cuz it's for 10-18lb. Even tho its for such small breeds being she was only one pound over the smallest weight I thought for sure it would fit. I could make it fit but it really was too tight for my comfort and I could barely get the velcro together. I'm ordering the small. Its really nice. Nicely made really soft and my dog hated getting in her old one. She just let me put it on her without trouble. Its going to work much better. Hugs much more securely.
customer_reviews.author: dawn webb

customer_reviews.title: Not good for separation anxiety
customer_reviews.text: My dog has terrible separation anxiety and I bought this to see if it would help keep him calm while he is alone. It did not help. I left him alone for 20 minutes and he barked constantly. He does not have kennel anxiety he is fine in his kennel when I am home but as soon as I leave he freaks. I gave this a 2 star because it does seem to keep him slightly more chilled out than normal, so I do believe this is a good tool to maybe help while training your dog but definitely doesn't help with separation anxiety.
customer_reviews.author: chelsea

customer_reviews.title: Helped Some
customer_reviews.text: Not a miracle but did help some. This is the first year we have had our terrier mix. I knew he was not going to like fireworks because he's not a fan of thunder. People in our area shoot off fireworks from the beginning of June thru the end of July at all hours of the night. The thunder shirt helped some. What helped more was brown noise turned up on the computer in a loop. It helped drowned out some off the popping and banging. Also playing with him and keeping small pieces of treats handy each time he heard a noise I distracted him. Eventually we were able to sleep. He wore his shirt all night long.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip B

customer_reviews.title: The concept works fine -- it wasn't a 100% solution for our dog's ...
customer_reviews.text: To call this product a cheap piece of trash is an insult to cheap pieces of trash. The velcro -- which is to say, the stuff that makes the coat work -- pulled off the fabric of the coat the first time we used this. The concept works fine -- it wasn't a 100% solution for our dog's anxiety, but it was maybe a 60% solution. But this execution of the concept isn't worth the money. I don't know if the original concept / brand name product is better made for its higher price, but it most certainly could not be worse made.
customer_reviews.author: dbschlosser

customer_reviews.title: Works way better than I expected!
customer_reviews.text: I have seen these on TV and was skeptical. Then I read other reviews on here while browsing for one, and I decided to get one. I have a mixed breed, medium sized dogs (abt 30 lbs) that has major anxiety during thunderstorms, fireworks, etc. He has had mild seizures a couple of times from it. Trying this made me a believer! The first time I put it on my dog during a bad storm, he instantly calmed down! Almost too calm, he relaxed and just laid on the floor and was quiet and calm. Works better than any dog treats or CBD treats for calming I've ever tried. It works!!
customer_reviews.author: SeanM

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in Sizing and Fit
customer_reviews.text: WAY too small, and I even bought the largest size for my Aussie. And it bunches up and pulls forward. I forgot to return it before my "time" expired and now I'm stuck with it. If you have a "hairy" dog, this probably won't work the way you hope.
customer_reviews.author: WSDareMe

customer_reviews.title: Life changer
customer_reviews.text: I have an older large lab that has become very nervous of thunder as he ages. Although this did not completely cure his anxiety, he is much, much better. Combine this with "calming pill" and you have a whole new dog. FYI - this is also the Perfect first aid item. My other dog got caught up in the fence. Many stitches later she is fine. However, the stitches were in a bad spot. She could lick them and they were susceptible to being torn out. I put this on her to secure the stitches and keep the wound clean. My vet said it was an amazing idea.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Richardson

customer_reviews.title: It was helpful in calming my dog.
customer_reviews.text: I adopted a toy poodle last year. She is a lovely happy dog except whenever I take her in the car, the dog buggy, or in the buggy to the library. She cries even though my other little dogs are with her. She was very comfortable with the jacket on from the start. We went for a long walk with her jacket on. When we got to the library I put her in the buggy with the other two dogs and she just laid down. She whimpered a little but not her usual plaintiff cry. Next we will try the car and go on very short drives around the block at first.
customer_reviews.author: j.o.

customer_reviews.title: Total fail
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately this did absolutely nothing for my Pet. It also seemed to be a little small. He is a golden retriever /Australian shepherd mix. He is the size of a male golden retriever and about 83 pounds. The extra large which is for 70 to100 pounds barely seemed to fit. In any case it did nothing to reduce his anxiety. Total fail
customer_reviews.author: Curvy Italian Girl

customer_reviews.title: If Velcro touches the seams it will pull out the thread
customer_reviews.text: The material seems comfy for my dog. It does calm her down. It is made of a soft t- shirt material. The only problem with this product is that the Velcro gets caught on the thread of the seams. If the Velcro touches the thread of the seams at anytime- ex. When putting on/off, storing the product- the Velcro will pull the threads. That is what makes the product not last long. Thread at the seams is pulled out at so many different places now. I try to be careful too. They should do something about the seams, maybe change the type of thread/material at the seams so the Velcro will not catch on it
customer_reviews.author: G's Mom

customer_reviews.title: As good as Thundershirt
customer_reviews.text: This seems to have really made a difference for our naughty female Jindo with separation anxiety. Without this she would often scratch up the carpet and chew on the baby gate that keeps her separated from our male Jindo in the house. Since she's been wearing this while we're at work she's done neither. Our male Jindo has the gray version, and the velcro came unstitched which is common, including with the Thundershirt. We used fabric glue to repair it and it works good as new.
customer_reviews.author: K. Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: I wish it would have worked :(
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my dog for car rides. She gets very anxious. I medicate her with anti-anxiety meds for longer car rides but I wanted something to supplement that and to use for shorter car rides that weren’t worth medicating her for. It did nothing to soothe her unfortunately. I wish it would have worked! I’m jealous of everyone who had luck with this. For reference she’s a 15lb poodle terrier mix and I ordered her a size small. I’ll attach a picture of her for reference and cuteness (she’s passed out in her bed in the car due to her meds).
customer_reviews.author: Gabriella

customer_reviews.title: Good product, but too small.
customer_reviews.text: My Australian Shepherd needs something to keep her calm & less stressed during July (fireworks) & while we prepare to move this week. I ordered thinking the M would be big enough but it was too small--the strap didn't even go around her. It was a mistake on my part not to measure, I know, but the sizzling chart is a little misleading. I think you should change it to give strictly inch measurements so people don't get confused. Anyway, now I have to wait until after I move to order a new replacement because it won't get here in time beforehand. I'll update this later when I've had a chance to try it out.
customer_reviews.author: BatGirl

customer_reviews.title: Within 5 minutes she is calm and sleeping like a baby
customer_reviews.text: This works WONDERS! My 9 year old dachshund has developed a fear of lightening, not the thunder or loud noises, the flashing lights. Overnight thunderstorms had become a nightmare at our house. She’s up, she’s down, she wants under the covers, she’s too hot under the covers and wants out, I wake up with a nose shoved in my eyeball (you know trying to warn me we’re in grave danger). I was getting zero sleep. Now, at the first wake up alert of lightening from her, we get up and slap on this jacket. Within 5 minutes she is calm and sleeping like a baby. LITERALLY a life saver!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa D

customer_reviews.title: Like that it has more natural materials
customer_reviews.text: Like that it has more natural materials, but I wish it was 100% cotton &/ organic. Pilled quickly. But with our dog, any sweater seems to help. He is afraid of thunder. He tries to basically "fuse" with the nearest person and just pushes into us as hard as he can. If he cannot find one of us, he will hide under a desk shaking and whining. He is still scared but he is noticeably calmer. But like I said, any sweater seems to help him.
customer_reviews.author: CETop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Helped With Car Anxiety!
customer_reviews.text: Our golden retriever was afraid of the car. She got car sick as a pup and although she outgrew the sickness, she was a nervous wreck to the point of visibly shaking in terror the minute she got in the car. The vest has helped to calm her down and so she can at least lay down and not tremble in fear!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Size Wrong when following The Chart
customer_reviews.text: Own a medium sized Border Collie. She weighs about 30 pounds. Ordered this anti anxiety wrap according to her chest size as was instructed on the page. This wrap was huge on my dog. I had to wrap it around her almost twice and then the velcro that was made to hold the end was covered leaving a long end flopping when my girl walked. Because of the extra wrap around the dog she got extremely overheated. Very disappointing as I had ordered it to have it for July fourth and it was not useable. Had to return it and buy one from a competitor that fits great
customer_reviews.author: Katidid

customer_reviews.title: Looked promising, but didn't work at all
customer_reviews.text: I own a six year old Maltipoo that has terrible separation anxiety. If I leave her in the house, she full-on wolf howls the entire time and if I leave her in the yard, she paces around in circles non-stop for hours. Decided to try this calming coat to alleviate the anxiety. The fit was very good (extra small, ~10lbs), but it didn't do anything for the anxiety.
customer_reviews.author: S. Chen

customer_reviews.title: Reverse affect for my Dog
customer_reviews.text: My Dog appears anxious, and unhappy WITH this “Calming Coat” He wears sweaters every winter so its not the clothing aspect? I weighed him and took measurements so its not too tight - I bought for his fear of fireworks - might have been a waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: These coats were well made and easy to put on
customer_reviews.text: Bought some of these coats for my wiener dogs. (douchsands) For their size, their more on the "husky" side of weight; still small. The medium was so tight it barely held together. I can't say to whether the coats work or not. However, there was a difference to how they acted with these and body style collars. These coats were well made and easy to put on. As many others say, get the larger size than what you think you need. Maybe even two sizes.
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: Marerial tends to pill and a little bit too thin
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the 4th of July. The sizing chart recommended 55 pounds dog need a large. I have a golden retriever. I thought goldens and husky and labrador are about the same size, I ordered the XL for my dog, and it turned out to be way too big. The material is soft and thin, but it seems fragile and easy to break and tends to pill. Despite my mistake didn't order the correct size, it feels cheap and definitely not worth the price. I would not recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Billbillman

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: While this seems well made and a great idea it’s not doing much for my dog even after rigging it tighter. I used the size chart and it was a bit big so be sure to really check the size because returns are a hassle and you get charged to ship it back and have to wait over a month for a refund so needless to say not happy with It a definite waist of money because I don’t have the time or patience to return it did absolutely nothing for my rescue pup. I do not not recommend this for anyone
customer_reviews.author: Liz Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Must Have for Anxiety Dogs!
customer_reviews.text: It's that time of year this becomes extremely important! Our dog has terrible PTSD and was abused and scared with loud things prior to us rescuing her. This jacket combined with some calming melatonin tablets are the only way she gets to sleep during the insane fireworks season (which should be a night but here last for 6-8 weeks!) We bought this back in 2016 and I just thought to review because it truly has held up over the years, been used so many times, and actually helps!
customer_reviews.author: Brandi N.

customer_reviews.title: Great Calming Coat
customer_reviews.text: I have a real nervous nelly longhaired 12 yr old dachshund that pants, slobbers and shakes when there is thunder, lightning, fireworks and gunfire. I give her 1/2 of 1 gram Xanax and put this coat on. It calms her immediately because the Xanax hasn’t taken effect yet. She even likes sleeping in it. She doesn’t like the Velcro noise when we take it off and actually have to muzzle her so she won’t bite. But, all and all, it’s a great help.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Helpful for transitional anxiety in our newly adopted dog
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this coat for our newly adopted dog to help ease some of her transitional anxieties. The sizing chart seems accurate and we were able to use the suggest size for our dog. The coat is made of soft jersey and our dog adjusted to it quickly. The coat helped quite a bit as we taught her to sleep in her kennel and also to sleep in the house but outside of our bedrooms. It also helped with her whining when we left the house and she quieted more quickly. Right now we hardly have to use it which is wonderful progress for our family.
customer_reviews.author: run slow, finish whenever

customer_reviews.title: It does calm my dog
customer_reviews.text: I had to order a second one as the first one (large) was too small for my Airedale. The XL fits around her chest well. The stitching was coming apart on the velcro as the photo shows. I sewed it together and was able to try it during a thunder storm. It did calm her down. I was also disappointed that the info said from New Zealand but yes, it was made in China. I will keep it and use it but I am disappointed in the poor sewing.
customer_reviews.author: hdfooter

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this for our German Shepard that is terrified of storms. We purchased the XL and she is about 76 lbs. It fits, but it is a little snug around the neck. If the fit was better around the neck, I would give it a 5 star review. This really works at calming our dog down. When it is storming or raining, our dog runs around and won't lay down. She is constantly pacing around the house. Once we put this on her, she almost immediately stops panting and will actually lay down. She is still scared, but no where near as much. I was skeptical at this working, but it really does. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: By golly, it works! Our vet had prescribed medication, but by the time it took effect, the storm was often almost or entirely over. Our Donovan now seems to understand that the vest is comfy and willingly lets us put it on. (It is easy to put on and fits nicely. I ordered according to the weight chart.) Most important, thundershowers are often predicted and don't happen. So now, we put on the jacket when thunder is predicted and take it off when the threat is passed. If there is thunder, it keeps him calm. Donovan definitely recommends this product!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I don't recommend this one
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this wrap and another, slightly cheaper brand. Both are made of the same, stretchy fabric. While this one has a wider Velcro closure, it is smaller than advertised. I ordered size large for a 48-lb dog whose chest measures 31 inches. When I wrap this around her and pull it snug, maybe half the Velcro sections meet because it's just not long enough. Also, it tends to bunch and wrinkle. The effect during fireworks was minimal, though that's not the fault of the article itself. Nothing--not prescription meds, CBD oil, or a calming shirt--helps during the horror that is July 4th in my town.
customer_reviews.author: sherri

customer_reviews.title: nice product, didn't work for my anxious dog
customer_reviews.text: The shirt fit nice and tight, but didn't seem to decrease my dog's anxiety at all. Then, when I went to remove it at night, she nearly had a heart attack when I had to detach the velcro. That escalated her anxiety 500%! And then made her fear the shirt completely. So, velcro is magical, but not a good idea for a dog that is very nervous and anxious. I had to return the item, which went very smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: Roberta Nadel

customer_reviews.title: My 4 hour experience :/
customer_reviews.text: I have a Redbone Coonhound who seems to have separation anxiety. I purchased this product with the hope that it would calm him and at first I thought it was working. Unfortunately within 4 hours of putting it on him (following instructions), checking its tightness and making sure that was properly fitting him, he had already chewed the chest strap. The reason I give this post three stars is because I'm honestly not sure if it actually works because there wasn't any real time to test the theory. I wish either it was produced with a different material or have separate attaching mechanisms to keep nervous, anxious dogs from chewing through it immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Donovan

customer_reviews.title: It works !!
customer_reviews.text: For years we have struggled to help our oldest fur baby with no luck. From taking to vet getting meds that did nothing when 4th July came along and broke a window. We have try hemp calming chews it has help ..but omg this vest is so crazy simple and so effective. I bought for New Years I got it with prime got it right on time on 31st and midnight came along and my baby was good and calm I was so surprised how a vest can calm my poor baby that has Anxiety. Thank so much for making the vest ...TRY IT PLEASE IF YOU HAVE A DOG THAT HAS ISSUES SPECIALLY FOR NEW YEARS AND Independence Day
customer_reviews.author: Martha

customer_reviews.title: It really works!
customer_reviews.text: I thought hese kind of shirts were just a bunch of bunk, but since my shih tzu was getting more and more anxious with every storm I thought I'd give it a try. Without the shirt she will pace, cower and try to hide when the storm approaches. Now with the shirt, she will curl up and lay calmly without a care. Yesterday as a storm approached, I asked her if she wanted her shirt and she wagged her tail and jumped up on the bed so I could put it on her. It's amazing what a difference it makes.
customer_reviews.author: Baseball Betsy

customer_reviews.title: A very good product for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I would recommend this product. Our Westie recently had minor surgery that left a number of small sites where she had to have stitches on her back and hindquarters. The vet recommended a shirt and this product turned out to be perfect for our need. The material feels like a stretch t-shirt and is thick enough to prevent her from tearing out the stitches but light enough to be comfortable and not overheat her. The product is well constructed, the information on fit was very good and the price is right for the product. In closing I'd note that wearing the coat at night has help our Westie deal with some discomfort which was interrupting her sleep.
customer_reviews.author: Beach Day

customer_reviews.title: Calms an anxious pup
customer_reviews.text: My little multipoo had awful anxiety after we adopted her. She would shake and constantly be in your face to make sure you still loved her. After putting on the jacket, she calmed and even began to doze without being on high alert, like usual.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Looked like was used
customer_reviews.text: When I opened the package the coat was full of dog hair. Looked like was used, returned and then resold to me. I'm disappointed that something from AKC would allow that to happen. I did keep it because our dog was in great need but washed it twice before allowing her to wear it
customer_reviews.author: Jonee Davis

customer_reviews.title: Was so skeptical...
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical in purchasing this. But as I sit here during an Arizona monsoon thunderstorm, next to my chihuahua, (who is NOT shaking but nearly sleeping as he listens to the thunder), I am a believer!! I bought the Extra small for my little 7 pound dude and although it’s still a bit big, I think after a washing and drying it may fit just right. I would definitely recommend this. Little Edelman is loving the security!
customer_reviews.author: MHanzie

customer_reviews.title: This Calming Coat Helps
customer_reviews.text: I have used this Calming Coat on our dog 3 times. He is a blue heeler and barks a lot. He even barks at thunder. I put this jacket on him and he not only quit barking, he laid down and went to sleep. He still barks at other stuff, but this coat keeps him calmer. The thing I don’t like is that it bunches up around his mid-section, which isn’t a big detourent. It is a good value. Gratefully, Kathy
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Chambers

customer_reviews.title: Does not run small as some have said.
customer_reviews.text: I honestly can't give a fair review of the effectiveness of this product due to the sizing. I read a lot of reviews before purchasing and listened to the suggestion of others to order a size up. I went with the Medium for my miniature schnauzer who is a bit husky for his breed (he usually takes a medium or sometimes even a large in dog coats and sweaters). It is too big to be effective and I can't even get the velcro to make contact in some places. However, the shirt is made well. I waited too long to return it and have to decide if I will buy another one in the correct size.
customer_reviews.author: HJM

customer_reviews.title: The sizing runs very small...
customer_reviews.text: These must run extremely small. I ordered a medium for our medium sized dog and a small for our small dog. The medium fit the small dog, but would not go around our medium sized dog. I ordered them for the 4th of July, because my dogs just go crazy with fear when the fireworks begin. Unfortunately, I had to medicate my medium sized dog because the anti-anxiety vest didn't fit around him. The medium vest did fit the small dog, and seemed to quell her anxiety nicely. I think the product works - but order a size up from what you think your dog would wear...
customer_reviews.author: Blondy5

customer_reviews.title: It may be okay for some nervous dogs.
customer_reviews.text: Very nicely made, but runs a bit big. You don’t want that because it also stretches a bit. Not a strong feeling garment & did not help my fearful nervous Nelly. Also very warm garment for my southwest temps most of year. Might make good, kind of soft warm wrap for dogs in colder climes. I will try it again after adding more velcro to make it tighter for winter months here in AZ.
customer_reviews.author: lwwhite

customer_reviews.title: AKC was best choice for our BF
customer_reviews.text: We found out while watching Shrek with surround sound on that our Bichon Frisse is not fond of fireworks. We purchased the AKC and Thundershirt. Both were nice, but the AKC came a bit more down her torso and has a different, more secure style of wrapping. She is persistent and managed to Houdini her way out of the Tshirt twice. The only problem we experienced was the velcro coming loose on the neck wrap. It was a 30 second fix since my sewing machine was out for mask making.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Added to her stress...didn't help
customer_reviews.text: Our mini-schnauzer is terrified of fireworks and thunderstorms. Living in Florida, we get a lot of thunderstorms and neighbors who seem to think every day is a holiday worthy of fireworks. Ordered this to see if it would help her. Nope. She started shaking more when I put it on her. Definitely didn't calm her down.
customer_reviews.author: Laura T.

customer_reviews.title: I think it works great!
customer_reviews.text: We got sadie from a shelter about 6 months ago. Some type of terrier mix, she would constantly whine, bark, chew, at everything and nothing. When we put this coat on her, she almost immediately seems calm, and relaxed, and more often than not will take hours long naps, wherever she sees fit. Without the coat, she hardly sits still. So we love the peace and quiet it brings us. Our shepard mix, also a rescue is intrigued by this coat, so we bought one for him. He was found in a box abandoned at 9 months old, so his separation anxiety is still a huge issue, 2 years later, we are hoping it will help him too
customer_reviews.author: Alex D.

customer_reviews.title: Great, Calming Jacket!
customer_reviews.text: It really helps keep my lil Labradoodle out of trouble when we are away and definitely calms him down. He has separation anxiety and has gotten into things in the past so I'm glad we tried this. It's a little tricky to get on, but I'm sure I'll get faster at it once he's worn it a few times. He's 60 lbs and we got the Extra Large. It fits pretty well...a tiny bit lose, but not bad...I feel the Large would be too small.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: American Kennel Club AKC Anti Anxiety and Stress Relief Calming Coat for Dogs
customer_reviews.text: My sweet Daphne is a rescue corgi/mix. She is blind and deaf, and quite old. She has extreme anxiety when she gets stressed out. I didn't know if the calming coat would help her or not. I am so glad I took a chance. Typically one of her meltdowns would last 1-2 hours. Within 5 minutes of putting her in the coat, she was calm. It did take some time for her to adjust to wearing it, anything new is frightening to her, but she feels safe. So glad I purchased this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This runs VERY Small!! I ordered it for ...
customer_reviews.text: This runs VERY Small !! I ordered it for my female German Shepherd Dog who weighs approximately 75 lbs. I ordered the XL (I already have a Thundershirt for her but wanted a spare) - It is TOO SMALL...I can barely get it around her - and it slides up - it is also Not as well made as I expected it to be... I guess you get what you pay for....I will give it tyo someone who has a smaller dog and if I want a spare will order the Authentic Thundershirt which is well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Carol A. Oldrey

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put on dog, well made
customer_reviews.text: My dog hates it right now. However, it’s easy to get on her (even though she fights me a bit as I put it on). The material seems like good quality, and it feels as comfy as a baby’s swaddling blanket. I plan on getting her used to it as quickly as I can, since the 4th of July is quickly approaching and the poor dog is scared senseless when she hears the fireworks!
customer_reviews.author: Maggie

customer_reviews.title: Anti aniexty jacket
customer_reviews.text: Sooo I didn't think in a million years this "jacket" would help my dog with his constant barking when ppl blow off fireworks for about a month around the 4th of July but it actually does help. Now I am not saying that it completely made him stop barking especially when the louder fireworks go off but it definitely helped significantly. Definitely worth the money. Only con would be that it runs smaller. My dog weighs about 30 pounds and I feel it would be stretch for a dog in the 40-50 pound mark. See photo of Velcro for around the waist. Hope this helps other.
customer_reviews.author: Cassie Mong

customer_reviews.title: My bad - bought wrong size
customer_reviews.text: I misread the description and wound up ordering the wrong size for my 55 pound aussie. I gave it to a friend and her 28 pound pup fits perfectly. She says that her pup wears it during thunderstorms (which are notoriously frequent in the Texas Hill Country during spring and early summy), so all in all it is a good product that delivers the benefits advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Sissy in New Braunfels

customer_reviews.title: Velcro is sowed on wrong.
customer_reviews.text: The one we recieved had the Velcro on the wrong side making it unusable and did not resemble the instructions it came with for this reason. Luckily we still have a few days to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered two of these in the beginning of October and at the end of November the Velcro will not keep together. They was washed only 3 times as we have Three vests in rotation. Two are these and one is the thunder vest from pet smart. The one from petsmarr is still going strong. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan and Catie

customer_reviews.title: Runs WAY too small
customer_reviews.text: Measured my dog as shown. Measurements matched perfectly with the Large. WAY to small! Velcro didn’t even touch even with pulling to tightly! Hoping the XL isn’t too big! She’s a 55 lb Pit Bull without a big chest.
customer_reviews.author: SuziQ

customer_reviews.title: First one to actually fit my dog!
customer_reviews.text: Perhaps the problem is that my dog is an unusual size or something, but Traditional Thundershirt brand Thundershirts simply did not fit my dog. They were either too long, or too small in the chest region. This however fits my dog perfectly, and I have put it on him a couple times now, once as a test wear and once when he was stressed out, and he calmed down far quicker than usual during his stress out once this was on. I am very excited about this product and cannot wait to see how else it will benefit my neurotic dog.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Bassett

customer_reviews.title: Sadly didn't work
customer_reviews.text: We had to wait til we had a thunderstorm to see if it worked. Sadly today it had NO effect at all. Didn't see any different in the car on the way to the vet. It's great to see it worked for others. But did nothing for us. Biggest thing is we all try to help our stressed babies no matter what the cost. Two stars is for the effort and cost.
customer_reviews.author: Hummerscott

customer_reviews.title: My pooch won't take it off
customer_reviews.text: After hearing great things from others, I purchased this Calming Coat for my sweet yorkie Bella. I wasn't sure which brand to choose because its so many different one's advertised so I went with a name that I know and trust AMERICAN KENNEL CLUB AKC. 2 months later i'm so glad that I did. Honestly I don't know what it is about this jacket but my sweet Bella refuses to let me take it off of her. She loves wearing it. I haven't noticed any difference in her separation anxiety or her fear of storms but for the most part is I love that she loves it.
customer_reviews.author: D Fields

customer_reviews.title: Provides a steady comfort!
customer_reviews.text: I wasn’t sure this was working at first but about the third time wearing it I think we got the wrap compression just right! Roxy was actually calm on a 13 hour drive for vacation and was able to listen to directions because she wasn’t so rowdy! She’s a Lhasa Apso puppy, we got the extra small. Fits well, she’s about twelve pounds. She is a long dog so it just fits the first part of her torso but right where it needs to be!
customer_reviews.author: hurst

customer_reviews.title: Bought for a friend whose dog has super bad anxiety
customer_reviews.text: Bought for a friend whose dog has super bad anxiety. She has tried everything, without any relief so I decided to give this a try. She said that there's probably "no cure" for her dog, however, the dog did not chatter her teeth like she usually does, still hyper, but not as bad. Hope this helps!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew A.

customer_reviews.title: Did nothing for my dog
customer_reviews.text: Did not work for my Jack Russell terrier mix. He is very afraid of thunder and fireworks, and both times I put this on him for fireworks (the Fourth of July) and thunderstorms he was just as frightened as usual, and then irritated as he kept trying to rub off the coat. He's usually very good about clothing on him so I think the combination of him being stressed and wearing something didn't do him any good. I would not suggest this if your dog has major anxiety beyond reason (say your dog does not even seek comfort when scared), as I do not think a simple jacket will help that.
customer_reviews.author: Phoebe

customer_reviews.title: Stretches easily, doesn’t stay snug like it should
customer_reviews.text: Well it was perfect when I first put it on my doggie...but noticed it kept stretching & stretching, so definitely should’ve listened to the reviews...I threw away cuz I was annoyed then saw I could’ve returned it😩 so 0 stars for me
customer_reviews.author: m

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for my dogs!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping the vest would help decrease the stress for my dogs from the noise of fireworks.Does NOT help in anyway! Since the description says "American Kennel Club Anti Anxiety and Stress Relief Calming Coat for Dogs" I would say this is FALSE advertising. I would give "0" stars if option was available. Buyer BEWARE!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: rjg

customer_reviews.title: Works on anxious chihuahua with collapsed trachea
customer_reviews.text: My chihuahua gets very excited and anxious and it always made her cough because she suffers from a collapsed trachea. She also HATES putting clothes and muzzles on. Noth this though. She does protest when I try to put it on her, but once I start wrapping it around her she remains perfectly still. It immediately stops her coughing fits because it calms her down. It absolutely works! Definitely worth the $30 price tag.
customer_reviews.author: Nelsyda Perez

customer_reviews.title: Not for our dog
customer_reviews.text: I bought the extra large according to the recommendations for weight/size. It fit too tightly for our black lab mix and made it difficult for her to breath. I have gifted to our son's skinny dog to use like a sweater for cold weather so it wasn't a total loss. It didn't seem to help her barking problem, but our dog is 9 years old and it may be to late to expect her to change at this point.
customer_reviews.author: onlineshopper

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: This wrap fits my dog really well. I don't think it has really helped with anxiety or stress, but that could be that he needs something stronger to help him. It seems to help him on and off. Its really easy to clean as well as to put on him. It does move around a little if he's laying around and rolling on his bed, but it's easy to move back into place.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Good stretch
customer_reviews.text: It’s summer in the Midwest so I haven’t used it. The pink color is pretty and it fits well on her. I was going to use it for the 4th of July fireworks but even though my cray neighbors had really loud ones, she didn’t freak out so I didn’t need it. She’s an anxious dog so I’m sure I’ll use it when the weather cools off
customer_reviews.author: mogran

customer_reviews.title: Cute
customer_reviews.text: It is cute and I like the pink...however...it is a tad small. The next size would be too big as her last one (thunder shirt) was XL and way too big. That is why I ordered this one. I can get it on her but is pretty tight. these shirts do help with her fears so I will use it as long as she lets me put it in her.
customer_reviews.author: Ms.VickiD.

customer_reviews.title: Not for deep chested dogs
customer_reviews.text: I have a 70lb mutt with a very deep chest. My dog has very high anxiety and I was hoping this would help. After I put it on him, I saw a change right away. Yes!!! But the vest will slide once he starts walking and it doesn't work anymore. If he's laying down, it's great. But it's pretty much useless otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Good quality product
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves her new anti-anxiety shirt! I can't speak to how well it works for anxiety because she hasn't been in a stressful situation with it on yet. However, the product is easy to put on (if you follow the directions), of good quality and fits her well. I got the Large size since my dog is 50 lbs with a 29 inch chest measurement. It is a snug fit, but comfortable and not restrictive in any way. The material is a thick jersey and there are heavy duty velcro straps to keep it all in place. Glad I didn't pay more for a Thundershirt since this one seems just as good. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: k1s5dan

customer_reviews.title: My dog finds it comforting
customer_reviews.text: It didn't take long for my dog to appreciate the value of this item. I followed the instructions to acclimate her to it. She was suffering some minor separation anxiety all of a sudden. She now comes over wagging her tail when I lift it up and snuggles up into it. It has reduced her shaking when I need to leave the house. While she's only 46 lbs, I had to get the large version as the medium was too small. The large is a little too big, but with a little adjustment it works.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Maybe the Product Works and My Dog is Broken??
customer_reviews.text: My dog is terrified of thunder or unexpected loud noises so we decided to give this a try. Maybe it's just me, or possibly it's my dog, but we had a really hard time getting this on correctly, and even when I've done exactly what the directions say, I'm not sure it's actually on properly. It is snug, though, which should make him feel pretty calm. However, we've had several thunderstorms recently, and he's still flipping out. So... maybe the product works and my dog is broken, but it isn't really doing what it's supposed to.
customer_reviews.author: GirlMom2

customer_reviews.title: I do believe it helps; just order a larger size, especially if the dog is hairy!!
customer_reviews.text: Can't say that it absolutely resolves Zoe's fear and shaking but I do think it helps; didn't know if she would wear it or not as she's picky as to any thing being put on her; the only complaint that I have is though this is supposed to cover up to 70 lbs; Zoe is under 50 lbs but very hairy and so it doesn't meet and cover the velcro just barely on the edge enough to hold it on; I should have gotten a larger size but I didn't really use it till the last 2 weeks;
customer_reviews.author: L. S. KING

customer_reviews.title: I got her an XS and it fits her like I wanted but it seems to be digging into ...
customer_reviews.text: We got this for my dachshund who has separation anxiety as well as fear of thunderstorms. We have to leave her with my parents for the weekend and it's the middle of tornado season here so I'm hoping this will help her. It does already seem to be working a bit--she usually screams bloody murder when I leave but was very calm earlier when I left for the store. I got her an XS and it fits her like I wanted but it seems to be digging into her neck a little. We'll keep it and just see, if it starts bothering her, I'll send it back for a bigger size.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Runs small, material is not as sturdy . Velcro fasteners are cheap.
customer_reviews.text: I had bought one of these a couple of years ago for my dog and was very pleased. I ordered this one and was disappointed . I came too small . The Velcro fastener was cheap and didn’t hold . I was very disappointed. I would not recommend . I have bedlington terrier that weighs 15 lbs and has a chest size of 19” . This new shirt is too small.
customer_reviews.author: Proman

customer_reviews.title: My dog doesn't like wearing clothes of any sort
customer_reviews.text: Should have got this years ago. My dog doesn't like wearing clothes of any sort, and tries to get it off by rubbing her back on the carpet when it first goes on her... however the velcro is strong enough that it doesn't come off (14 lb dachshund). This is great, b/c she no longer shakes (it was getting to near convulsions as she has gotten older) when thunder or storms are near once she wears it... why can't she understand its for her own good?! Also, it washes well in machine and I hang dry it.
customer_reviews.author: DD

customer_reviews.title: Best Investment Ever
customer_reviews.text: This has been the BEST investment for my dog. He is a Shih Tzu Bichon Frise (Shichon) mix and even after being "fixed" he still was hyper. I bought this because where I live has had a lot of thunderstorms this year and I live in a military town (that celebrates holidays with firecrackers for several days). It has worked miracles. He is a lot calmer and I do not have to scrape him off the ceiling when firecrackers or thunder happens. My dog is not miserable, and scared and I can sleep without being woke up by a scared dog. I highly recommend this calming coat.
customer_reviews.author: nubbyfeet

customer_reviews.title: Im glad I purchased this jacket! It works!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this jacket! I was pretty skeptical before purchasing it, but I had to try something to help my dog with his anxiety. This jacket does not prevent him from having an anxiety attack, but it helps reduce the length and intensity of an attack. Product is almost like a soothing jacket. I'm glad I purchased it! I purchased a XL for my 70lbs dog. Chest area fit well. Mid section had extra room in it, but still works!
customer_reviews.author: AD

customer_reviews.title: The sizing chart seems to be pretty accurate and the quality is good
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this calming coat for my mom's chihuahua/jack russell dog in size small. The sizing chart seems to be pretty accurate and the quality is good. Zippo is extremely terrified of storms/thunder and other loud noises and my mom said it seems to make him somewhat calmer. When we first got it and tried it on him several times (not during a storm), it did seem to make Zippo want to just lie down and rest. So surprisingly this anti-anxiety coat does seem to help her dog, and we are keeping it.
customer_reviews.author: Terri Holland

product_meta.title: AKC - American Kennel Club Anti Anxiety and Stress Relief Calming Coat for Dogs
product_meta.description: Color:Grey| Size:MediumBh Pet Gear-Calm Coat Medium. Perfect for providing relief from vet visits car trips hyperactivity noise anxiety crate anxiety thunderstorm anxiety and excessive barking. This package contains one calm cat coat for chest sizes between 18 inches to 26 inches. Comes in a variety of colors. Each sold separately. Machine washable. Safe and drug-free. Imported.
feature_bullets: Provide relief from vet visits, car trips, hyperactivity, noise, anxiety, crate anxiety, thunderstorm, anxiety and excessive barking
Contains one calm cat coat for chest sizes between 18 inches to 26 inches
Please do refer the Size Chart from the image section before ordering.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
